alert.note: Alert for Caddo; Canadian; Cleveland; Grady; Oklahoma (Oklahoma) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued August 11 at 10:29PM CDT by NWS Norman-Oklahoma City
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of northern Grady, northern Caddo, southwestern Oklahoma, northwestern Cleveland and southern Canadian Counties through 1100 PM CDT... At 1029 PM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from near Mustang to 5 miles west of Minco to near Lookeba. Movement was east at 25 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts of 40 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Locations impacted include... Oklahoma City, Del City, El Reno, Yukon, Bethany, Mustang, Warr Acres, Tuttle, Union City, Minco, Binger, Lookeba, Cogar, Woodlawn Park, Cedar Lake, The Capitol, Wiley Post Airport, The Fairgrounds, and Will Rogers Airport. This includes the following highways... Interstate 35 between mile markers 125 and 128. Interstate 40 between mile markers 125 and 154. Interstate 44 between mile markers 113 and 125. Interstate 240 between mile markers 1 and 2. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. These storms may intensify, so be certain to monitor NOAA Weather Radio, local radio stations or available television stations for additional information and possible warnings from the National Weather Service.
